alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 13 at 11:44PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following area, Monterey. * WHEN...Until 245 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1144 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Seaside, Monterey, Pacific Grove, Carmel-By-The-Sea, Del Monte Forest, Del Rey Oaks and Sand City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
